values:
So it's 1:30 and here I am on the internets (George Bush joke)  and I am starving.  I need some more money to eat, between here and work I've eaten about thirty huge Strawberries because they were free.  I swear if my fecal matter ain't bright red by tomorrow I'll be surprised.  I find it strange that I consider money spent on food a waste, thus I don't buy food unless I am starving to the point of physical pain.

Tomorrow I am waking at 8 am, why?  Not because I have to, because I want to condition my body, I really don't like being up this late and waking up at 10 or 11, it feels like such a big chunk of usable time is taken away.  I want to be up by 7 and in bed as soon as I get home and showered from work, so that means midnight.  On weekends...I will never sleep, or oversleep.

My payday is tomorrow so that means I will be making a few purchases:  School books...two of them...which will probably total over 150 dollars...fucking book companies make a killing by stealing the bread money from poor college kids.  Did you know that publishing companies come out with new editions every year just for the sake of profits, so that teachers have to have their students buy the newest editions.  This way there aren't as many used books in circulation that can be used for the classes.

Sad thing is these "new editions" are simply nothing more than cosmetic changes, a few extra pictures, a new cover, a few chapters in different place, different questions.  They are pretty much the same.

In edition to the books, I will have to buy a nine volt battery for my bass, and probably new strings too.  The ones I have been using are well over 6 months old, you should change them every 3 months.  Got to buy work gloves too, sick of having my hands covered in Chinese dust and rat feces... I work in shipping and receiving.  

I forget how to do LJ cuts, sorry.

In the seven tongues of God, could this be a revival?

Probably not, I don't think anyone reads these anymore.  Not even my own friends read their's.
So, things that have gone on in my life since my last update.

Still single : (....my bands dormant, haven't practiced in over a year as a band, I write a lot more.  I'm in college full time, and work full time.

if there is any response to this once sleeping cadaver of a livejournal mayhaps I'll continue its use.

Lots o' adventure lately, lots more to come in days ahead as spring rises.  What is the first day of spring?  My calender doesn't seem to mark the changing of seasons.  What is new with me?  In the days that have passed I have taken up to playing bass again with burning passion.  I have seen the Sun rise, but most of all and the best, I have a new girlfriend, and an awesome one at that, Kathryn.

Oh yeah there is an awesome local concert I want to go to it is some kind of power and death metal fest, 3 headed monster and Powerglove are playing so that would be awesome to see them.

 















"And what I see
You can not see
That when I move
You move with me"




"Queen of all my sleepless nights
For whose beauty I, Faun
have played my pipes, with heart
Queen in white silk, skin like milk
Horns of Faun, lips of dawn"

In the east the new sun has risen. The warm green spring has returned early for me, it comes and melts away the endless winters that have piled on. Did you see the Sun rising? Did you hear the robin singing?

"From where it burns spirals of exotic scents
Rose, sandal, jasmine, all kinds of incense
Aged fragrances only dreamed of once
Dragons do dream far beyond the sense
We make love in the dusty throne
of a Modern Sodoma"

The smoke was rising from the lap of Ganesh, did you breathe it in so deeply? Did it send you to lands beyond the sea?

"When I move
You move with me
I feed off you
You feast on me"


"We are the four arms of the solar Cross"

North, East, South, West
I will call to each of you
bring you four as one
bind you four there
rise!

"Depart now on your bright wings
The world envys
The skies have always seduced you
Precious Queen
and you know your time has come
To fly away with Me, so far..."

I saw there in the west a burning on the horizon.  The edge of the sky was red with the new rising sun.  Yet it did not rise on me yet, soon though I shall see it rise in all its glory over the clear sky.  The Moon was reborn on Monday, it was a new moon (check your calenders) it is waxing now and soon shall be full. 

"I must be free before the Harvest moon..."- Sonata Arctica


Man I speak in enigmas but those who understand are the only ones that need to so ha.

Heavy metal meltdown at work today!

This is not a log about my thoughts but more of a log of the day, so unless you find the adventures of young adults you may be bored. 

Hooo hhumm this time it better work!

So the night begins with JB, Keith, and Myself going to find this abandoned Zoo in Hudson. We scout out the area and man was it awesome, all kinds of huge buildings. We never got out of the car, just drove around looking for places to get in and park later. So we leave there and head on down to Leda Lanes, the local slightly famous candlepin bowling alley (one of three in New Hampshire). There we meet up with Vissa and Joe Rogan, they play a few rounds, I go get Garitron, they a play a few more rounds then we go on back to the Zoo.

Vissa had parted ways with us at Leda Lanes so it was down to just the five of -us. We made a qucik stop at taco bell, and 7-11 and then rode forth into battle. We parked on some side street, made a madman's dash into the cover of the woods on the other side of the street, walked around in lots o' thorns (I've cuts all over my hands and face.) We found the biggest building, but alas it was being renovated so we thought was wise not to try and bust in. We trudged back again in dismay through the bramble and thorns and made our way down another path. We came out into a huge area that seemed to be under construction for the earth was all bare frozen mud, we exited the adventure back onto the main road and walked some up the hill 'til we came to another entrance. We hopped the fence, poor joe Rogan cut his hand pretty deep, and slashed his jacket, Jb somehow flew over the fence. There we found some more once abandoned buildings under construcion but we came upon one that was not, the coolest one too luckily. It was the building where they kept the animals, cages on the outside and pens on the inside. We went into the cage and I had the strangest feeling, very dark and fear mongering. We exited the cage and to our luck the door to the building was wide open. We hop inside see all kinds of spray paint and broken things and then find a room that looked to be a kitchen. We went in and found a ladder that led up into a loft were some kind of monkey our bird used to live. That being done, with cold in our bones and blood on some of our skins we left the Zoo behind. There I split company from my men, and their adventures laid elsewhere, for I had already made plans with Kate and Binx, and as well as I can I try never to break plans.

I pick her up from Downtown and I find out Binx is sleeping, so we decide to go anyways. I go home and try to find some pants that don't have a huge whole in the thigh like the ones I have on now, but alas none were to be had. We arrive there (the Zoo again hahah) and this time having some foreknowledge of the area I managed to keep us on path the whole time and we never ran into many thorns. Seeing how awesome of explorers we were we found something new right off the bat, a random bridge over a small stream. We went over it , I payed the toll (a silly ritual I have when I cross over foot bridges, I always throw change into the river). We explored the same building earlier mentioned, but we explored it more fully I think, or atleast I did for it looked differnt in someways some more cages and such I didn't notcie, like the random fountain. After this we stumbled around some old paths making fun of eachother, and to my jollyness I heard the sweet voice of a creature known as the great horned owl. It seemed as a guide for after following it unintentionally we came to a Barn, another new place we didn't discover earlier. We looked inside, not much there so we exited. There I saw the owl take flight from the building into the trees beyond. We continued down further and through our great vikingness we found another new building, the Gorilla cage. We checked it out, and went into the Women's room bah ah ah such witty spray painters. After this we went forward and came to the end of the path at some pond, and call me Ishmael if I am a liar but I heard something jump into the water. We got lost ut eventually found our way out.

Our next adventure was mainly driving around, joking, yelling at people, yelling at Schwann's house. After this I dropped her off, and then a wanderlust burned in me so I drove as far as I could on one street for an hour simply because I had never been down that road. My goal in life is to explore all roads to all ends, to see all there is to be seen. All in all a wonderful night with awesome people, I hope these days never die.

Time for the first full update..hopefully none of you fall asleep.  Below shall be scribed:  a)  A strange dream that I had that would definitely make an awesome sci-fi channel movie.  b)  my thoughts on food nowadays.  and c)  A funny little story about my family history and modern terrorists.  All mentioned are contained within the LJ cut below  ::whirrly gigs and whistles::

                                                                                      


<lj-cut text="Hell's sold out, and Heaven's closed"> 

A dream within a dream?  No...Divine inspiration?  My dreams are quite vivid sometimes and I know that something is trying to tell me what to write about or sing about or sometimes it even tells me music, if only I had a good memory and knew how to write sheet music.  For example one time I heard the most beautiful song in my head it was a mix of classical music and celtic folk music complete with Celtic guitar and the six stringed hand harp.  But alas I can not remember the melody nor the harmony, I just have a memory of music that should have been.  But anyways on to the real topic.  A few nights ago I had a very vivid and long, detailed dream.  It began like this,,,

               Some friends, my mom's boyfriend and I were at the beach fishing.  We were about to leave when I felt a weight at the end of my line.  I figured it was probably a tire so I began to reel it in.  Then the tide helps bring it in and to my surprise it is a huge (about the size of me) Catfish like fish, it was green and had feelers like a catfish, but it had all kinds of strange symbols on it.  So I decided to keep it, and threw it in the back of a pickup, conveniently filled with salt water.  I drive it to some weird aquarium/ancient history museum and they put it in a large tank.  So I and some friend only from that dream who was an old black scientist were walking through the exhibits and looking at things.  Then he passed one exhibit and grew very alarmed.  Apparently the fish was none other than the one that was carved into some large clay pot that was in the museum.  On the pot was shown in relief many men worshiping the fish and making offerings to it.  He told me that the fish I had caught was the same, and that it was an ancient witch who took on the form of a large fish and destroyed ships, ate men, and all kinds of other nasty things.
  Like all cheap movies just when the story was finished the tanks all began to burst open, the witch used her mind to break all the glass and some how the place was waterproof so all the halls became filled with water, but we could all breathe somehow?  A huge shark attacks me, I throw it in a closet.  Then the fish shape shifts into a woman and says that I must die for what I have done, it is my destiny or something.  So she finds a cadaver that is just the torso and legs, and it is filled with pig entrails.  She empowers it via necromancy and it begins to chase me around.  I find a shotgun, and like in all dreams it doesn't work.  I wake up.
  Now tell me that doesn't make for a cheesy straight to dvd sci-fi movie.



Part Duex

We as humans consume so many foul and corrupted things.  All pumped up with nice chemicals, pesticides, preservatives.  Sure it keeps longer and looks cleaner, smells nicer but is it really still as wholesome?  I personally think one of the reasons so many Americans die early is the way we process food.  There are cultures in Southeast Asia where most of the men live to be 90 and are not bed bound vegetables., here most people die off at 70 and are usually very crippled and weak.  I try as much as time and my wallet allows to eat good natural food, even if it has things I am unaware of.  I stay away from all kinds of sweets, pickled foods, processed meats, frozen dinners, fast food, hell I haven't had a soda for years now.  I find that natural food tastes better too.  If I had the money I would live off  honey, water, berries, roots, some meats, bread, milk, cheese.  In short the Heathen's diet.

How I would kill for a caribou steak right now.

Now to the last part, anyone still reading?

So yesterday I was researching my family tales and stories and came across a slogan our family used to shout in battle long ago in heathen times.  "Leamh Dearg Abu!"  or in English "The Red Hand forever!"  The Red hand is a symbol of my family and it is the main figure on our coat of arms.  The red hand comes from a legend in which our sires had a race to claim kingship over Ireland, oh sweet Eireann.  Yes I am according to tale the descendant of the first Milesian man to land in Ireland, there were other races there but the Milesians are the only ones that remain today.  Well two brothers were in ships and came in sight of the shore, one said to the other "whoever lands there first the Druids say will be the first high king, let us have a race in the row boats and see who shall be king first."  So the two brothers raced and then when one saw he was loosing he cut off his hand (the red hand) and tossed it to shore thus securing kingship over the new land.  That is why the Red hand is upon my families shield, but now to the point..terrorists using my family slogan!  It seems that when I was researching my family I came across these boys



They use my families slogan as their motto, and as you can see there is my families "Red Hand"  placed upon their banner.  This is an Irish Protestant terrorist group whose main goal is to stop The republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland from becoming one again.  It is a shame upon me that they would dare use my families crest and motto in their quest.  I am sure that maybe founders of the group were distant relatives but it still doesn't let me rest knowing that my ancestors are shamed by these filth.

Does anyone read this anymore?  I am thinking about starting to update once every other day and putting meaningful, possibly interesting things in here soon, but only if enough people still read this.  I think with the onslaught of myspace this thing has become but a childhood memory to most.

Here is to George Bush for making another enemy for the U.S

 

"INAYAT QALA, Pakistan - Thousands of angry Pakistanis protested Sunday against a U.S. airstrike that killed civilians, chanting "Long live Osama bin Laden!" as anti-American rallies in the country entered their second week.

About 5,000 demonstrators assembled on a dry riverbed in a mountain market town near the site of the Jan. 13 attack. Shouting pro-bin Laden, anti-American slogans, they burned effigies of U.S. President George W. Bush.

Pakistani officials believe the strike killed four other top al-Qaida operatives, but also killed at least 13 civilians, including women and children

Thousands have taken to the streets in the past week at several rallies in Pakistan's biggest cities.

The attack was believed launched by a predator drone based in neighboring Afghanistan, where the United States has about 20,000 troops.

Pakistan does not allow U.S. forces to pursue militants across the border, or to launch strikes without permission

"America is the biggest terrorist in the world," said Maulana Mohammed Sadiq, a lawmaker and senior figure in the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam party, a member of the coalition of religious groups backing the rallies.

"America bombed innocent people inside their homes," he said.

Pakistan's opposition Islamic alliance said it would launch more protests Monday, including a march from the capital, Islamabad, to the radical hotbed of Peshawar and then on to Damadola."

 

Ho joy we have a about 150 muslims in a huge country that are mad at us.  and Pakistan is our ally to, what shame we bring upon oursleves in such an act..

Ten Top Trivia Tips about Rey's hooded wagon!

  1. The liquid inside Rey's hooded wagon can be used as a substitute for blood plasma.
  2. Research indicates that Rey's hooded wagon will be attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas!
  3. Two grams of Rey's hooded wagon provide enough energy to power a television for over twenty-three hours!
  4. Rey's hooded wagon will give a higher yield if milked when listening to music!
  5. Lightning strikes Rey's hooded wagon over seven times every hour.
  6. Rey's hooded wagon is the world's smallest mammal!
  7. In Eastern Africa you can buy beer brewed from Rey's hooded wagon.
  8. Rey's hooded wagon can not regurgitate.
  9. Never store Rey's hooded wagon at room temperature.
  10. You share your birthday with Rey's hooded wagon!

A question for all the ladies, even though I bet none read my journal :(

If I wanted to woo over a woman, how can I look less like a viking, because all I know how to go is the viking look, and no woman I have met has liked it.  I will never cut my hair though, it gives me evil powers, but I mean do I look better now without the beard, or would I look better with facial hair to hide my trollish face.  I love beards and such but I know many woman find them downright disgusting.  I mean I am humble and such but I know I am not an ugly man but it seems like I can never find a decent woman, I have had a few that I liked alot but none of them last, or they end up being terrible people, I have probably had only one good looking, nice girl, all the others were either bad looking, or had terrible personalities or both.

What I hate the most is when I find out a girl I once liked used to like me but now months later she doesn't or has a boyfreind. 

Another thing I am stuck on in decisions, what to do with woman?  Should I seek out someone to love, and have for a long time, which is what I want more than ever but it seems too Idyllic, or should I just have fun and enjoy youth hedonistically with many different women.  Which is fun, and also I won't be able to do that when I get older.


And why does it always seem the one woman I ever want is impossible to have because all the normal means by which I woo woman , won't work on that one?


Damn my mortal shell!


Hail Oden!


And when the hell are all my old freinds and other such people going to start hanging out again!

oH YEAH!

and her is my cell phone number is 966-8369  Sooooo everyone should call me up or text me to hang out or just talk cause, I don't use it at all now that I am single again!?!

Bwhaha I never update do you know why, because no one replies, yes it is all your fault! Well life has been ok, had a good relationship dumb things happen, but now I am single and attempting to woo me a woman. I think I am going to go buy a real sword, lately I have felt that I might need a real one incase something happens....zombpocalpyse? Well I know my sword will shine with that of my freinds.

Actor Pat Morita, whose portrayal of the wise and dry-witted Mr. Miyagi in "The Karate Kid" earned him an Oscar nomination, has died. He was 73. Morita died Thursday at his home in Las Vegas of natural causes, said his wife of 12 years, Evelyn. She said in a statement that her husband, who first rose to fame with a role on "Happy Days," had "dedicated his entire life to acting and comedy." In 1984, he appeared in the role that would define his career and spawn countless affectionate imitations. As Kesuke Miyagi, the mentor to Ralph Macchio's "Daniel-san," he taught karate while trying to catch flies with chopsticks and offering such advice as "wax on, wax off" to guide Daniel through chores to improve his skills. Morita said in a 1986 interview with The Associated Press he was billed as Noriyuki "Pat" Morita in the film because producer Jerry Weintraub wanted him to sound more ethnic. He said he used the billing because it was "the only name my parents gave me." He lost the 1984 best supporting actor award to Haing S. Ngor, who appeared in "The Killing Fields." For years, Morita played small and sometimes demeaning roles in such films as "Thoroughly Modern Millie" and TV series such as "The Odd Couple" and "Green Acres." His first breakthrough came with "Happy Days," and he followed with his own brief series, "Mr. T and Tina." "The Karate Kid," led to three sequels, the last of which, 1994's "The Next Karate Kid," paired him with a young Hilary Swank. Morita was prolific outside of the "Karate Kid" series as well, appearing in "Honeymoon in Vegas," "Spy Hard," "Even Cowgirls Get the Blues" and "The Center of the World." He also provided the voice for a character in the Disney movie "Mulan" in 1998. Born in northern California on June 28, 1932, the son of migrant fruit pickers, Morita spent most of his early years in the hospital with spinal tuberculosis. He later recovered only to be sent to a Japanese-American internment camp in Arizona during World War II. "One day I was an invalid," he recalled in a 1989 AP interview. "The next day I was public enemy No. 1 being escorted to an internment camp by an FBI agent wearing a piece." After the war, Morita's family tried to repair their finances by operating a Sacramento restaurant. It was there that Morita first tried his comedy on patrons. Because prospects for a Japanese-American standup comic seemed poor, Morita found steady work in computers at Aerojet General. But at age 30 he entered show business full time. "Only in America could you get away with the kind of comedy I did," he commented. "If I tried it in Japan before the war, it would have been considered blasphemy, and I would have ended in leg irons. " Morita is survived by his wife and three daughters from a previous marriage.

Orphaned Land, Folk metal hailing from the deserts of Isreal.  One of the finest and few Eastern Folk metal bands around.  They combine Progressive metal skills with traditional middle eastern folk elements and give the whole thing and epic story between Christianity, Judiasm, and Islam.  Sure all their songs are religous but not in the sense of "become or jew or go to hell"  more in the sense of drawing influece from the great religions of the middle east.  The album "Mabool" is a must have for any folk metal fan, or metal fan in general, it is enjoyable even beyond just the novelty sense of a unique metal style.

 

Orphaned Land- Ocean Land (the revalation)

A lot has happened since I last updated I think.
I am single, and looking for a good woman to love, I work full time as a reciever now...hahah reciever.
Radiata stories is the best rpg ever, I don't know why I havent played it yet today.
Therion was epic live.
I havent been writing or playing much bass lately, but I will soon.
I am takings SATs soon.
I had crazy dreams last night and so I will right them down kinda, and I have no idea why but Indians were in it alot haha.

The first one was kinda realistic, I was with my girlfreind (who happened to be an Indian girl I used to like back in the day).  we were talking about some trip we were going on, some wierd guy comes out of no where and tries to kidnap her so I go all crazy and start fighting him like a ninja and chase him off...and thats all I remember from that one.  Next one...I was walking down a street and I see this fisher cat and it goes over to this little indian boy who is about a foot tall and it picks him up and starts slamming his head against a wall, so I run over save the kid and crush the fisher cats head in my hands and throw him into the sea.

the next one ties into the first dream, I guess when I was going home from my "girlfreinds house"  I somehow got launched into the future, and I said "damn now I am going to miss the trip she will think I am ditching her"  all of a sudden these huge robots come marching out of no where and I boot it.  then all the robots are hunting me down, I guess they are cops?  and sylvester stalone comes out of nowhere and wants to fight me, he has a gun so I say "lets fight like men"  so he drops the gun and I rip his leg off and destroy him, then the robots catch me and sylvester stalone minus one leg walks up to me and I wake up.

Woooo

Speaking of sucks I have work tonight 'til 1:30  I wish I had more than one or two friends who would hang out that late!

Well nothing is new, still single, working full time, taking SAT'S October 9th.

"Chewing Gum With a Bizarre Side Effect 
The makers of Bust-Up gum are making an extraordinary claim for women: Chewing this gum will increase the size of their breasts. Medical News Today, the New York Daily News, and the BBC News all report that the gum contains extracts from the Pueraria mirifica (Kwao Krua) plant, the magic ingredient that will make a woman's breasts grow, as well as improve their shape and tone. Chew the gum and the extracts are slowly released."


I thought that'd be interesting news, I guess wrigly is looking to make a viagra chewing gum?   What is up with these companies these days

My new car is pretty cool.

Hail Metal soldiers and the not so metal soldiers.

I got a brand new car bitch is I am going to have to work like crazy to afford it because I have to get insurance on my own which is like 400 a month as opposed to 80 a month when I was under my mom.

Oh well at least I have a cd player in it and its a reliable car.

Well that means once school comes Kyle will no longer sleep he will be working, schooling, practing bass, and writing.

We fucking need a practice space so many people are asking in on my band lately and I have so many people set up to try out.

a lot of guitarists into the metal we like.

We had it best at Wayne's not only because it was free, but we bassically practiced whenever, and it was our freind's house so we always hung out there and we didn't have to worry about or stuff getting stolen or anything.  But I am sure wayne's grandpa wouldn't like us back there again hahah and he will probably be back home in september.

If I begged my mom endlessly I bet I might be able to get us in here but we would only be able to practice til five on week days and not at all on weekends.

if we rent it is going to cost money and I know Chris will pay but I would much rather have like four or five helping out because I don't think I could take on too much more finacially.  I am not even sure if I iwll be able to gather enough money for Prog-Power fest.

Other than that life is good, good friends, good girlfreind, new car, starting to write alot.

are we stuck to just bowling and hanging out at 10:30 at night,

When I get my new car that means trips all the time, visits to the chosen one, various woods, and beaches.

August! August better be the best of the three months of summer, for it is the last we have.

In the spirit of horror movies.


DAWN OF THE DEAD 2 (IN TALKS) 
No official plot yet. 

DAY OF THE DEAD (REMAKE)
No official plot yet. 

DAY OF THE DEAD: CONTAGIUM (PREQUEL)
Sometime in 1968 a strange viral outbreak is contained within the walls of a military hospital in Pennsylvania: all those exposed are destroyed and burned to the ground. A wall of silence befalls the incidence, and soon enough only a vague myth remains. The hospital becomes a civilian mental treatment center. 

RESIDENT EVIL: AFTERLIFE 
No official plot yet, but it's said to be set in a post-apocalyptic world overrun by zombies. 

RESIDENT EVIL 4 
No official plot yet. 

RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD 4: NECROPOLIS 
No official plot yet, but it's said that it's about kids (skateboard punks with shotguns) who break into an experimental mutation lab. 

RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD 5: RAVE FROM THE GRAVE 
No official plot yet, but it's said that it's about these kids that realize if you take Trioxin in very small doses you can have a life-after-death experience, "so it becomes like a big rave drug." 


UNDEAD
Peaceful, rustic Berkeley is a charming fishing community where life is sweet and the people friendly. All that is about to change. After losing her childhood farm to the bank, local beauty Rene decides to leave town and head for the big city. Suddenly, an avalanche of meteorites races through the sky, bombarding the town and bringing an otherworldly infection. Departing is going to be much more difficult than she had planned.

THE WRETCHED 
The story follows bounty hunter named Rellik, whose job is to help wipe out the population of undead in the Old West. He takes a young man nicknamed "Twenty-One" under his wing to show him the ropes, but after returning from a successful capture they find discover that some settlers have accidentally unleashed all the undead from their holding place. 

EVIL DEAD (REMAKE)
No official plot yet. 

EVIL DEAD IV (IN TALKS)
No official plot yet. 


Thats it for now for more check out http://www.upcominghorrormovies.com/movies.php
